oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Calcium Channel Blocking Drugs in Cardiology: Clinical Aspects
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kittleson, Mark D.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: calcium antagonists
vascular smooth muscle
conduction
calcium depolarization
myocardium
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The principal actions of calcium antagonists are to produce relaxation in vascular smooth muscle, to depress conduction and automaticity in regions of the heart where conduction and automaticity are controlled by slow calcium depolarization (e.g. sinus node, atrioventricular node, ischemic myocardium), and to depress contractility and improve relaxation in myocardium. They may also be useful in preventing calcium entry into diseased myocardium resulting in "salvage" of myocardium.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: AAVPT Biennial Symposia; Fifth Biennial Symposium; 78
